message_1: A factory produces 1000 bottles of soda per day. The manager wants to know how many bottles of soda the factory will produce in 6 days assuming that none of the machines break down during that time. Using causal logic, how can you determine how many bottles of soda the factory will produce in 6 days?
message_2:
Using causal logic, we can determine the number of bottles produced in 6 days by multiplying the daily production rate by the number of days. Since the factory produces 1000 bottles of soda per day and the manager wants to know the production for 6 days, we can calculate it as follows:

Number of bottles produced in 6 days = (Daily production rate) × (Number of days)
Number of bottles produced in 6 days = 1000 bottles/day × 6 days

Number of bottles produced in 6 days = 6000 bottles

So, the factory will produce 6000 bottles of soda in 6 days, assuming that none of the machines break down during that time.
